basics.name: David Brownman
basics.label: Software Development Engineer
basics.summary: Software Engineer and all around tinkerer. I like productivity apps, CSS, automation, and folk music.

awards.title: GTM Hero
awards.summary: Awarded for "Acts of cross-fucntional heroism" and enabling the sales team to excel as a result of extraordinary work

work.summary: Created internal tools that upped the productivity of other employees, both technical and non-technical. Also worked directly with the CTO to quickly roll out (mostly) pre-alpha and MVPs of new projects.
highlights: Acquired by Salesforce 3 months after joining
Re-wrote internal information site in the interest of stability and user experience
Created a full-featured ruby sdk to access our API
Architected a testing framework from scratch to provide unit tests for our Zapier app
Maintained a set of ruby and javascript scripts and plugins that drove business operations

work.summary: Technical lead responsible for the creation and maintenance of the IRDP website.
highlights: Worked closely with the International Quidditch Association to power worldwide referee certification tools
Internationalized most of the site into 3 languages
Used Parse to implement backend and authentication and expanded Parse Ruby Gem to fit site needs

work.summary: Full stack web development, focusing on Rails. Creating webpages from mockups, improving data processing for external links, and social media management.
highlights: Learned Ruby/Rails, Javascript, and HAML on the fly to be able to be a productive member of the team
Aided marketing intern int he production of Google ADWords campaigns, demographic targeting, and UX design

work.summary: Backend development on a Python/Tornado stack. Developed on the API and improved object oriented design of storage objects.
highlights: Expanded upon a flexible API to afford access to Mongo objects both internally and (eventually) other developers

volunteer.position: Co-Founder, Webmaster, Director of External Relations
volunteer.summary: Along with two others, founded and nurtured the team into greatness
highlights: The team won multiple tournaments, was the only team to ever beat Middlebury (World Cup V), and was at one point ranked #3 in the world
Planned two incredibly successful Yule Balls (2013, 2014) which both sold out (raising generous capital)
Coordinated a successful Indiegogo campaign that raised $2600

volunteer.summary: Participated in twice-weekly rehearsals, frequent gigs, and twice-yearly concerts.
highlights: Competed twice in Kol HaOlam (National Jewish A Cappella competition) in Washington DC, winning 3rd place on our second outing

volunteer.summary: Coordinated day care activities for under-privileged youth in inner-city Houston.
highlights: Coordinated outings, such as a group trip to the Houston Zoo
Acted both as a role model and a source of stability for kids generally lacking in these areas
